msDesc.head: Conradus de Ebraco, Sermones, etc.; Germany (?Cologne), late 14th century (?1396)

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermons
Table of contents, listing nine sermons in ink, followed by an added entry in plummet, apparently ‘de recommendacione sacre scripture’
msItem.note: (fol. i verso) Four-line note quoting Augustine, De opere monachorum, cap. XXV, 33
msItem.incipit: Augustinus, in libro de operibus monachorum, Neque propterea ad pietatem divites humiliantur, ut pauperes ad superbiam extollantur
msItem.note: Perhaps by the same hand as the list of contents on the recto

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: Dirigite viam domini. Johannis primo. Abbas et doctor mellifluus beatissimus pater noster Bernhardus destituti hominis
msItem.explicit: et habito in medio vestri etc. et finis huius sermonis.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in adventu Domini
msItem.rubric: Sequitur secundus sermo de adventu domini
msItem.incipit: Induimini dominum nostrum Ihesum Christum. Ad Romanos 3º et in epistola diei presentis Bernardus doctor inclitus humani generis nuditatem
msItem.explicit: Cuius dulce nomen sit benedictum in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in vigilia natalis Domini
msItem.rubric: Sequitur sermo de vigilia nativitatis Christi
msItem.incipit: Santificamini cras enim faciet dominus inter vos mirabilia. Josue 3º. Licet magnum pietatis sacramentum quod chorus prophetarum venerandus olim
msItem.explicit: qui est super omnia benedictus in secula seculorum Amen Amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in capite ieiunii
msItem.incipit: Faciem tuam lava. Matthei sexto. Beatissimus pater noster Bernhardus abbas et doctor egregius considerans faciem nostri interioris hominis
msItem.explicit: qui est super omnia benedictus Amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: Unge capud tuum. Mathei sexto. Sacre scripture appotecam speciebus aromatum supercelestium ac universi pulveris pingmentarii copiositate refectam
msItem.explicit: honor et gloria in secula seculorum amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo de festo Pasce
msItem.incipit: Sitis nova conspersio. Prima ad Karintios 5º. Venerabilis pater noster Bernhardus abbas egregius verba nostri thematis pertractans
msItem.explicit: Qua nobis concedat qui vivit et regnat … Amen. Et sic est finis huius sermonis in dei nomine Amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo in die Pasce
msItem.incipit: Circa dominice resurreccionis profectum solent moveri questiones videlicet
msItem.explicit: de ascensione allegatur Elige quod placet
msItem.finalRubric: Et sic est finis istarum questionum de resurrectione domini.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo de ascensione domini
msItem.incipit: Ascendit super omnes celos ut adimpleret omnia. Ad Effesios 4º. Beatus Bernardus abbas et doctor egregius considerans huius festivitatis gloriam preclaram
msItem.explicit: vel motus progressivus inquam dicitur asscendit.

msItem.incipit: Circa hoc occurrunt questiones de asscensione domini. Primo de ipsius potentatu quali vi ascenditur
msItem.explicit: qui est super omnia gloriosus in secula seculorum amen.

msItem.incipit: Implemini spiritu sancto. Ad Effesios quinto. Spiritus sanctus qui est lux inobfuscabilis et doctor veritatis et pax inobfuscabilis et doctor veritatis et pax imperturbabilis
msItem.explicit: remedia salutis omnibus qui ab ipsius generacionibus cupiunt adimpleri
msItem.note: Also present in St Florian, Stiftsbibliothek, MS XI 270, dated 1442

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Collacio ad prelatos et sacerdotes
msItem.incipit: Perfecti estote ad Korintios ultimo. Reverendi patres ac domini Si mores dignitatibus si virtutes statibus si honoris gradibus rite compensamus
msItem.explicit: Ihesus Christus super omnia benedictus in secula amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo ad pastores
msItem.incipit: Sobrii estote et vigilate Primo Petri ultimo. Reverendissimi patres ac domini si figuras vetustatis mente cupiamus, si scripturas veritatis corde revolvamus
msItem.explicit: Ihesus Christus qui est super omnia benedictus in secula seculorum amen.

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo ad viros ecclesiasticos, clericos, et prelatos
msItem.incipit: Posui te in lucem gentibus. Hec sunt verba patris luminum Isaye 49º. doctoris gentium et luminis ecclesiarum Actuum 13º. Que licet sint specialiter dicta de filio dei
msItem.explicit: Cuius nos participes efficiat ille Amen

msItem.author: Conradus de Ebraco
msItem.title: Sermo de sancto Thoma de Aquino
msItem.incipit: Hic est heres. Mathei vicesimo primo. Universitatis rerum ordinem sedula mentis attencione curiosius indaganti
msItem.explicit: Ihesus Christus dei filius qui est super omnia benedictus in secula seculorum amen.

msItem.incipit: Baptizabit vos spiritu sancto. Marci primo. Doctor mellifluus ac in divine sapiencie suavitate prefulgidus pater noster Bernhardus
msItem.explicit: Que sunt verba lectionis Apokalipsis primo. Et sic est finis huius sermonis.

msItem.incipit: Flumen dei repletum est aquis. Psalmo 62º. [recte 64] Arcam sacre scripture multiplici fertilitate fecundam
msItem.explicit: qui vivit et regnat in unitate spiritus sancti deus per omnia secula seculorum amen.

msItem.colophon: Expliciunt sermones domini conradi de ebroco sacre theoloye professoris Anno Anno domini mº cccº xviº
msItem.note: A ‘i’ is added before the ‘x’ and a ‘.96.’ added after it, in paler ink, suggesting that the intention was to change ‘x’ to ‘ix’ and thus Roman ‘16’ to ‘96’, i.e. altering 1316 to 1396.

supportDesc.support: paper; with narrow parchment MS. reinforcement strips in the center of each quire
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–93, in pencil signed and dated by ‘B.C. B[arker]-B[enfield] 23-x-1980’

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in 2 cols., c. 34–42 lines, column space 160–75 50

handDesc.handNote: Gothic cursive (bastarda), with several changes of script, most strikingly at fol. 2v.

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for 2-line initials not filled in.

binding.p: Medieval limp parchment binding, with sewing through a rigid tanned leather back plate with two metal bosses, and four holes in a cross or lozenge pattern. (Cf. Szirmai, The archaeology of medieval bookbinding, figs. 10.12, 10.14.)
The front cover inscribed with 15th-century notes on the contents.
The foot of the spine with a 17th(?)-century paper label inscribed ‘38’, and ‘379’ in the 18th/19th-century.

history.origin: 1396 (?) (Watson, Dated and datable, no. 135) German, Cologne (?)
history.provenance: Cologne, the Charterhouse of St. Barbara: with their list of contents and ownership inscription: ‘Liber domus sancte Barbare in Colonia ordinis Carthusiensis’ (fol. ir); inscribed in the 16th century ‘Author horum sermonum est Conradus de Ebroco’ (fol. ir); listed as ‘Sermones Conradi de Ebraco’ in their 17th-century inventory (Cologne, Historisches Archiv, Kartäuser, Repertorien und Handschriften 14; see R. B. Marks, The Library of the Charterhouse of St. Barbara in Cologne, Analecta Cartusiana, 21–22 (Salzburg, 1974), II, p. 430, no. 00 138); their MS 379 (cf. spine and inside front cover); the house was suppressed in 1796.
Johann Matthias Heberle, bookseller and auctioneer of Cologne; sold in 1821 as part of a group of about 135 MSS. from St Barbara’s, Cologne, to:

Leander van Ess (1772–1847), of Darmstadt (on whom see Hermann Knaus, ‘Die Handschriften des Leander van Eß’, Archiv für Geschichte des Buchwesens, 1 (pts. 3/4, 1956), 1958, 331–36, and Milton McC. Gatch, ed., ‘so precious a foundation’: The Library of Leander van Ess at the Burke Library of Union Theological Seminary in the City of New York, exh. cat. (New York, 1996); MS 77 in his Sammlung und Verzeichniss handschriftlicher Bücher (Darmstadt, 1823); his collection sold en bloc in 1842 to:

Sir Thomas Phillipps (1792–1872), his MS. 462, with this number and his stencilled rampant lion crest (fol. ir); sale at Sotheby’s, Bibliotheca Phillippica, 6 June 1910, and following days, lot 207; bought by Maggs Bros.

Albert Ehrman (1890–1969); with his lozenge-shaped armorial bookplate above his notes in pencil; Broxbourne ledger no. R 1151; inscribed ‘1151’. next to his lozenge-shaped ‘AE’ ink stamp (inside back cover).
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian by his son, John Ehrman, in 1978 through the Friends of the National Libraries.
